intro: Microlicia longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-fruited microlicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elongated, hairy fruits. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
